reviews.review:
Half-Life a servi de base à la plupart des jeux de Valve (Portal, Counter-Strike, Team Fortress, etc.) et son gameplay simple et épuré est devenue la signature de tous les jeux de ces derniers.

On plonge ici à l'origine de tout, dans la peau de Gordon Freeman, scientifique de chez Black Mesa.
Suite à une expérience qui tourne mal et une résonance en chaînes, (kézaco?) les créatures du monde parallèle Xen envahissent le centre de recherches !
Votre mission ? Vous en sortir vivant ! Pour ça vous aurez plus d'une dizaine d'armes, parmi un certain Pied de biche :)

L'atout du jeu réside dans un savant mélange d'action-FPS et de phases de plates-formes, ce qui était assez novateur pour l'époque (encore aujourd'hui ?) par rapport à d'autres FPS.
L'IA des ennemis (en particulier des militaires) sait être offensive comme défensive, ils n'hésiteront pas à se trouver une couverture ou à venir vous débusquer quand vous vous cachez.

L'histoire quant à elle est à l'image de tout le reste, très simple mais avec également une très grande part de mystère. Attendez-vous à la fin du jeu, à vous poser beaucoup de questions auxquelles vous n'aurez que quelques réponses dans les prochains Half-Life.

Et cerise sur le gâteau, si vous aimez le jeu, Gearbox (les développeurs de la série Borderlands entre autres) a développé deux "extensions" (Blue Shift et Opposing Force) qui utilise aussi le moteur GoldSource (le moteur d'Half-Life).
Et c'est sans compter la pléthore de mods pour jouer de nouvelles aventures !
D'ailleurs, certains n'ont tellement rien à voir avec le jeu d'origine et ajoutent tellement de contenue qu'ils ne s'agit plus de mods mais de jeux à part entière.

Pour résumer, Half-Life n'est pas un jeu qui prend la poussière au placard, on prendra toujours plaisir à y rejouer de temps en temps :)

At the time of this review, This game is almost 20 years old. And out of the many games I have played from the late 1990's this one holds up exceptionally well. The gameplay starts with a slow opening but picks up well and sets an excellent setting for this sci-fi adventure. This game IS a bit lacking in the music department. Using ambient noise to augment the settings and the dystopian theme of the game. But settings and narrative aside this game sets an excellent example of a game that does not need shoot-em-up action and 4k graphics to be good. (although the graphics DID NOT hold well through the years) Its just enough to overlook.

Overall this game is a MUST HAVE if you are into games like DOOM or other sci-fi shooters. And this game constantly goes on sale. (I got it for just one dollar!). Definitely pick this game up or just go the full mile and purchase the Valve Complete Pack.

Your Mission Survive and Escape Black Mesa (Area 51) 
Don't expect your MIT Graduation to help you on this one

I didn't play [b]Half-Life[/b] when it was initially released, only now did I try it for the first time. And I must honestly say that the hype is deserved. However, the game is not without its flaws.

[u]Graphics[/u]

The graphics is not the reason why you would want to play this game. It's a game from 1998 and it shows. There are some HD mods that can improve the textures, however buttons and other interactable objects still have no depth and look like they have been painted on the walls.

[u]Story[/u]

The story is where this game shines out the most. Not as much for what it tells - there are only a few important things going on in the game - but for how it is revealed. The story is revealed bit by bit through observations and short interactions with NPCs. The protagonist is silent. There are no books, no logs and almost no cutscenes. The story is the experience itself.
However, the game does not take itself seriously. There are elements of comedy in some scenes and NPC lines. And for me that is a flaw, because it doesn't fit the overall crisis situation.

[u]Level design[/u]

The game offers a seamless transition between the levels. They are built in a way that almost always the player intuitively knows where to go and what to do. It is accomplished without any mission logs or map markers. In some situations there is more than one way to go, but no matter which way you chose you reach the intended destination. Furthermore, the level design complements the story.
This is some master level level design.

[u]Gameplay[/u]

The game starts slowly and for about first 15 minutes there's not much going on. But then the pace becomes faster and you face increasingly harder situations with a good balance between shooting and puzzle solving. However, there are some points in the game, when, if you don't have the right type of ammo, you are screwed. Multiple reloads or cheats are required to get past those bottleneck situations.

The endgame is particularly punishing, and also confusing. There's a lot of platform jumping, multiple enemy spawns and very hard boss fights. I'd say even too hard for easy difficulty.

[u]Other notes[/u]
-It doesn't feel like the protagonist is walking, but more like sliding. A single press of a movement button takes you quite far. It's just too sensitive. For that reason I experienced quite a lot of problems with ladders and moving platforms, and fall damage was the most frequent type of damage that I took.
- The grenade throwing is very inaccurate and covers only a short distance.
- Shotguns and assault rifles have spray patterns.
- Crouch jumping is a thing.
- The soundtrack is amazing and available as extra content within the game files.

[u]Final words[/u]

Unless for the annoying endgame that tested my patience, [b]HL[/b] would have been one of my favourite games. But, nevertheless, I still think it's a good game and worth playing. Even in 2018.

[b]My overall rating:[/b] [u]8/10[/u]
the Best Game!!

《半条命》开创了FPS游戏众多先河，影响了很多后世的FPS游戏，更是告诉大家，FPS在完美剧情的加持下更加出色。对于一个1998年出的游戏不能要求太多，游戏默认的是中文的配音，赞！虽然能了解是让我干什么，但是游戏内没有什么提示，很容易迷路。游戏的画面就不多说了，毕竟是上个世纪的游戏引擎了，但是游戏性和可玩性放到现在依然很棒！对于一个20年前的老游戏来说，能够做到今天这样就已经非常罕见了，所以评论里说《半条命》是FPS游戏界的鼻祖、神作之类的话一点也不为过。

Легендарная игра 1998 года, с которой началась новая эра шутеров от первого лица. 
Главный герой - физик-теоретик Гордон Фримен, пытающийся сбежать из огромного научно-исследовательского института Блек Мейза, расположенного в пустыне Нью-Мексико, приследуемый военными и пришельцами, заполонившими комплекс словно муравьи, после того, как эксперимент с таинственным кристаллом из "пограничного мира" выходит из под контроля и происходит Каскадный Резонанс... 

Half-Life 1 - первая игра, созданная с нуля тогда ещё молодой компанией Valve - выходцами из Microsoft-а, решившими заняться производством компьютерных игр. Именно с этой единственной игрой за плечами они так стремительно ворвались в игровую индустрию с наступлением нового миллениума. 


[i]Фримен, ломик, Блек Мейза, хэдкрабы, булсквиды, вортигонты, хаундайи, Ксен, Джи-мен, Комплекс Лямбда, длиннющая поездка на вагонетке на монорельсе, поездка в вагончике из начальных титров длинной в 5 минут... Боже! Сколько же приятных воспоминаний из детства! х3[/i]


[h1]Сюжет: 10/10[/h1]
Хоть многие со мной тут и не согласятся, но я считаю, что в отличие от первоначальной трешовой задумки Вельв с космическим байкером Иваном и орбитальной станцией, то, что мы получили в итоге - игра с достойным сюжетом! И ладно, что персонажей тут мало и среди них нет "индивидуальных", но зато есть целый пограничный мир Ксен со своей флорой и фауной! А изучая внешний вид пришельцев и их анатомию, можно даже примерно определить их роль в экосистеме того места, откуда когда-то пришёл в Ксен их вид.

[h1]Атмосфера: 10/10[/h1]
Ну тут и добавить нечего: в этой игре идеально всё! Блек Мейза сделана о-о-очень атмосферно! Каждый новый сектор выглядит по-другому, с какими-то уникальными чертами, которых нет у других... И даже Ксен выполнен на удивление хорошо! Хоть многие игроки и жалуются на то, что надеялись увидеть мир пришельцев не только как парящие в воздухе острова земли.

[h1]Геймплей: 10/10[/h1]
Носится, конечно, наш Фримен как угорелый... но не забывайте о том, что это игра 1998 года, а её движок - сильно переделанный движок от Quake. Для своего времени это был настоящий прорыв! За исключением этого играть в Халф-Лайф 1 очень приятно, а подавляющее большинство багов связано исключительно с переносом игры в Стим.

[h1]Графика: 10/10[/h1]
Кто-то скажет: "Майнкрафт", а я скажу: "Вы сначала посмотрите на графон других топовых игр того времени!". Тот же Deus Ex 2000 года выглядит намного хуже, чего уж говорить о других играх... Поэтому графика у Халф Лайф 1 - одна из самых лучших для компьютерных игр своего времени.

[h1]Итоговая оценка: 10/10[/h1]
Да вряд ли вообще есть люди, которые не играли в этот шедевр... Что? Вы не играли?! Да Вы, должно быть шутите... Нет, правда, что ли? ТОГДА БЫСТРО БЕГИТЕ СКАЧИВАТЬ HALF-LIFE 1 И ИГРАТЬ В НЕЁ НЕ ТЕРЯЯ НИ МИНУТЫ!!! XP

Admittedly the game had the best graphics of its time. The complex design of maps, highly intelligent AI, and very deep interactions with the environment are something that even games nowadays have hard times trying to do. However, for people like me who just don't like FPS and puzzle solving that much, the plot in this one is too sparse to be any real enjoyment.

The only bad thing about it is the graphics, but it was 1998, so it's forgivable. Overall, this is one of the best games of all time, and if you have $10 to spare, you should definitely get it.

Half-Life is a game that has revolutionized games that we play today because of its story and mechanics. Even from the 1990s this game is still a great game to play, more so with mods to see how creative the fanbase can be.

Un antes y despues en los videojuegos! Una leyenda que hasta el dia de hoy puede enseñar a muchas compañias a hacer un muy inteligente y divertido video juego. Un juego que respeta al 100% al jugador con una historia atrapante, una jugabilidad y unas mecanicas que te haran pensar cada movimiento. Un diseño de personajes, niveles y puzzles excelente!! igual no deberia tomarseme en cuenta ya que soy un fanatico del mismo. Es muy dificil de explicar a las nuevas generaciones de jugadores lo que este juego significo para la epoca y el cambio que produjo en la industria. Ojala algun dia continuen con su atrapante historia, soñar no cuesta nada.

This game is what set Valve on its way to a multt-billion dollar industry, paving the way for the FPS genre, and winning multiple game of the year awards. The gameplay is solid, the plot is gold, and the way Valve carefully structures their flawless and breathtaking master peice still holds up to this day.
I recommend this game to anybody with a computer, a brain, and any sense of value.

I don't like shooters very much, but I have done about 500 hours of them.

What I like about this game is:
[list]
[*]Is straight (no bullshit and cars like 2)
[*]The level design is one of the best I have seen
[*]The weapons are interesting
[*]It feels real (inmmersive)
[*]It is easy to get used to (except the long jump) and the difficulty curve is good
[*]The save system is comfortable
[/list]


What I DON'T like about this game is (which it amounts to very little weight actually):
[list]
[*]The ending boss is terrible
[*]The damn Xen jumps
[*]Sometimes people does not follow you like they should
[/list]

10/10

I like this game.


10/10

[Best Review?]

Fame

This game has gotten more famous a few years after Half-Life 2, then back in 1998. The Release of Half Life 2 Made people skip this game, but Others Installed this to see what It was like.

Info

You guide freeman, or If you're more creative, Yourself Through Vent climbing, Puzzles, Hair Tearing Moments, Outside the box moments, and some deja-vu, and some "Thats what she said" Jokes included. This game is frightening where you have to think. I like that, It helps players Innovate. This game is great, but can be hard at times. 


Having fun while playing


If you want to amuse yourself while Playing the game, when you get the crowbar, Dont just kill those Xen creatures, Also kill all scientests, Officers, And whatever you can find, and Just End Their Fucking life. It can be hillarious. Be sure to mess with lots of other mechanics, and Impulse 101 (Cheats are required, for Noobies, Turn on Dev Console and type SV_Cheats 1 first)

Fanbase

This game is a Very Popular game, and the Fanbase Still Kinda Holds up. People have made beautiful stuff out of Half-Life. Thing's like Freeman's Mind (Ross Scott), and Whatnot. Sometimes I parody Freeman's Mind alone and talk to Myself and Commentate my OWN Character. I'm weird. :P


Updates


Updates are never happening, really. The last update we got was like almost a Year ago Where Valve Launches a Wee Patch to It. It also Reached Blue Shift and Opposing Force (Also Good).
 
Glitches

There's Barely Any, not Counting the Glitches used for Speedrunning (Bunnyhop, ABH ((Ik It's only in HL2, I dont Care.)), Etc).

Horror

The horror used in this masterpiece, are creepy feelings and the creatures. It can give a 5 year old nightmares. So that gives something to worry about if Pixels 2 comes to life. Yeah, Don't Introduce it to your younger brother like I did.


Engine Quality

Half-Life runs on gold source, A heavily modified Quake 1 Engine. It has great looks, a fancy health and armor counter in the corner, and some great graphics. just dont think of dark soul- FUCK I TRIGGERED YOUR MIND


Final score: 9.1/10

Last Word: But Seriously why is Half Life Source a Piece of Shit to You Guys?

98년대 게임치고는 그래픽과 스토리 음향 모든게 혁신적이였다. 살면서 한번쯤은 해봐야 되는 게임이다.
그니깐 오렌지박스 사지말고 밸브컴플리팩을....

A game with a wonderful story and fun gameplay, this is not going to be a short review. When the game start, it makes you feel like in real a military factory. Other games will try to make a work place in their game, they'll most likly not make reallistic, while in half life 1, it makes black mesa look like real place with airvent leading to other rooms you been before to lockers having names of your coworkers.
The story is really immersive, it will make it you through your eyes to the end, even no cutscenes. You don't what happening in the rest of the base, but you know it not good when the military want to kill everything in it.
The action in game is also reallistic, the soliders do stratigies to alien creatures act like animals in some areas. In this game, you either act like a well train soilder or a very caution scientist. In this game, you don't feel safe anywhere. You don't know where the next headcrab could be hiding or not knowing where the next group of soilders could be.
This game will make you feel hyped from the in the beginning to the end. 





Also the voice actors are not random youtubers.
